intro: Malcolmia turkestanica, commonly known as the Turkistan mallow, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant features showy yellow flowers with five petals, typically blooming in summer. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
